alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fillmore; Franklin; Furnas; Harlan; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 10:49AM CST until January 01 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches possible. In addition, strong northerly winds of 20 to 25 mph with gusts to around 30 mph may result in blowing and drifting snow along with reduced visibilities. Wind chill values by Saturday morning could be as low as 15 to 25 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Saturday evening. Most of the accumulating snow should not start until a few hours after midnight on New Year Eve night. The heaviest snow is currently expected during the day on Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The brunt of this storm system is still a few days away and thus at least some changes to the forecast are likely. Therefore, please keep up to date with the latest details if you have travel plans over the holiday weekend.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
